results.title: The Effects of Maternal Metformin Treatment on Late Prenatal and Early Postnatal Development of the Offspring Are Modulated by Sex
results.text_hl: However, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may also be useful in pregnancies at risk of @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@intrauterine growth restriction@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@IUGR@@@) since it improves placental efficiency and the fetuses' developmental competence.

results.title: Role of Metformin in Preeclampsia: A Systematic Review.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment significantly reduced the incidence of @DISEASE_Pre_Eclampsia @DISEASE_MESH:D011225 @@@preeclampsia@@@ (P = 0.04) and @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@intrauterine growth restriction@@@ (P = 0.035) compared to the control group.

results.title: Placental and cerebral circulation in fetuses of mothers with polycystic ovary syndrome and the effect of Metformin exposure.
results.text_hl: The reported @DISEASE_Fetal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D005315 @@@fetal@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@growth restriction@@@ in @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@-offspring and the larger head size in @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ exposed fetuses may not be explained by altered umbilical and cerebral pulsatility indices, or their relationship.

results.title: Perfluorooctanoic acid alters the developmental trajectory of female germ cells and embryos in rodents and its potential mechanism.
results.text_hl: Importantly, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ blunts @CHEMICAL_perfluorooctanoic_acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:C023036 @@@PFOA@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@fetal growth retardation@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@FGR@@@) and such protective effect could be recapitulated by transplantation of fecal material and pharmacological activation of @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@.

citations.NLM: Huang C, Wu D, Zhang K, Khan FA, Pandupuspitasari NS, Wang Y, Huo L, Sun F. Perfluorooctanoic acid alters the developmental trajectory of female germ cells and embryos in rodents and its potential mechanism. Ecotoxicol Environ Saf. 2022 May 1;236():113467. PMID: 35390687

results.title: Effect of metformin on biomarkers of placental- mediated disease: A systematic review and meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: Overall, our findings show that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ mediates several molecular pathways implicated in the pathogenesis of @DISEASE_Pre_Eclampsia @DISEASE_MESH:D011225 @@@pre-eclampsia@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@intrauterine growth retardation@@@.

citations.NLM: Anness AR, Baldo A, Webb DR, Khalil A, Robinson TG, Mousa HA. Effect of metformin on biomarkers of placental- mediated disease: A systematic review and meta-analysis. Placenta. 2021 Apr;107():51-58. PMID: 33798839

results.title: Protective effect of metformin on the NG-nitro-l-arginine methyl ester (l-NAME)-induced rat models of preeclampsia.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The study findings demonstrate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ administration improves blood pressure and 24-h @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@, alleviates fetal @<m>DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@growth restriction@@@, ameliorate @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ cytokines, and restores the balance of angiogenic factors and endothelial function.

citations.NLM: Hao H, Li F, Wang F, Ran J, Chen Y, Yang L, Ma H, Wang J, Yang H. Protective effect of metformin on the NG-nitro-l-arginine methyl ester (l-NAME)-induced rat models of preeclampsia. Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2024 Nov 13;739():150996. PMID: 39550868
